result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian Porter Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Fine of $500.00 including all mandatory costs, fees and surcharges to be paid from bail on deposit.

Court will grant expungement upon successful completion of the sentence and all municipal tickets being paid in full and proof of such provided to the court.
Consecutive to: to any other sentence. Huber to apply FOR WORK AND WORK SEARCH. DEFENDANT REMANDED.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brian Porter Jr.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Brian Porter in court with attorney J. Dennis Thornton.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant waived rights and pled guilty.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 

The Court ordered the Defendant to serve FOUR MONTHS in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 2 days time served.  Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply FOR WORK AND WORK SEARCH. DEFENDANT REMANDED. 

Fine of $500.00 including  all mandatory costs, fees and surcharges to be paid from bail on deposit 

Court will grant expungment upon sucessful completion of the sentence and all municipal tickets being paid in full and proof of such provided to the court. 

Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed..

Defendant Brian Porter in court with attorney J. Dennis Thornton.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 47. lr  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 07-09-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Brian Porter in court with attorney J. Dennis Thornton.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Defense requests an adjournment. Court granted defense request. Case adjourned to branch 47.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 8, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Brian Porter in court with attorney J. Dennis Thornton.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 47. lr  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 05-26-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Brian Porter in court with attorney J. Dennis Thornton.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 47. lr  Status conference scheduled for 04-15-2015 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for 03-12-2015 at 08:30 am.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

As an additional condition of bail:
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Angelo B.    AND/OR  their residence     AND/OR   their place of employment

No dangerous weapons

Defendant Brian Porter in court.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
OCCR Tape #15-045

Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.
Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  
Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  The case is adjourned to Branch 47 for a Pretrial Conference.
